Basic site data

  • English equivalent: Chrysoplenium carnosum Long-stones
  • Site number: C-110

  • Geographic coordinate (N. lat.): 30º 00.6΄
  • Geographic coordinate (E. long.): 83º 39.1΄
  • Elevation: 4770 m
  • Administrative location (township): BaryangBar yangs

nodes.title: General site characteristics
nodes.body: Yachü DoringG.ya’ bcud rdo ring is named for the high altitude medicinal herb Chrysoplenium carnosum (also known as yakhimag.ya’ kyi ma). This site is located in the NyintröSnying ’khrod drainage system on the broad right/west side of a valley. The eastern vista is wide open but, in other directions, the view is much more constrained. The barren terrain is gently sloping and gravelly. A seasonal wash has formed cutting away at the bench to within 1.5 m of Yachü DoringG.ya’ bcud rdo ring.

nodes.title: Enclosure
nodes.body: A 3.7-m long fragment of the north wall of the enclosure has persisted. This wall fragment has been reduced to a single line of slabs (around 30 cm long), which are flush with the ground surface or slightly raised above it. At what was the southwest corner of the enclosure a single stone is in place. This stone is 4.5 m from the opposite/northwest corner of the enclosure, delineating the probable width of the enclosure. The enclosure does not appear to have been well aligned in the cardinal directions.

nodes.title: Pillars
nodes.body:
There are four highly eroded pillars at Yachü DoringG.ya’ bcud rdo ring. They host orange climax lichen, as do many ancient pillars in Upper Tibet. From south to north, the long-stones have the following dimensions and characteristics:

  1. Long-stone DR1: unevenly tabular, beige (1.3 m [height] x 1.1 m [basal girth]). The broad sides of this inclined specimen face in the anomalous east and west directions.
  2. Long-stone DR2: tabular, gray (40 cm x 55 cm).
  3. Long-stone DR3: tabular, gray (85 cm x 80 cm).
  4. Long-stone DR4: gray, broken (20 cm x 60 cm).
